blacklight.genetic.base package#

Submodules#

blacklight.genetic.base.chromosome module#

class Chromosome[source]#

Bases: ABC

Abstract class for a chromosome in an individual. Implements common traits between all chromosomes.

_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>#
abstract _mutate()[source]#

Mutate genes of this chromosome.

abstract _random_genes()[source]#

Randomly initialize genes for each type of chromosome if there are no parents.

abstract cross_over(*args)[source]#

Handle cross over between two chromosomes.

static get_shortest_chromosome(chromosome_a: object, chromosome_b: object) → Tuple[object, object][source]#

Determine the shortest and longest chromosomes.

Parameters:

  • chromosome_a (BaseChromosome) – The first chromosome to compare.

  • chromosome_b (BaseChromosome) – The second chromosome to compare.

Returns:

A tuple containing the shortest chromosome and the longest chromosome, in that order.

Return type:

Tuple[BaseChromosome, BaseChromosome]

blacklight.genetic.base.individual module#

class Individual(parents_genes=None, population=None)[source]#

Bases: ABC

Abstract class for an individual in a population. Implements common traits between all individuals. An individual is a KERAS Model. Genes are passed down from parents, or instantiated randomly. Individual is a base class that implements the basic functionality of an individual. Child classes hold specific information for different types of models.

_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>#
abstract _crossover(*args)[source]#

Crossover genes from parents to create new genes.

fitness = 0#
abstract get_fitness()[source]#

Get fitness of this individual.

_check_individual_inputs(parents, population) → bool[source]#

  1. Population can not be None

  2. If parents are not None, they must be a list of individuals.

blacklight.genetic.base.population module#

class Population(number_of_individuals: int, num_parents_mating: int, death_percentage: float, number_of_generations: int, options)[source]#

Bases: object

An abstract class representing a population of Neural Network topologies that can be evaluated. Their GOAL is the current dataset that this population wants to work on.

_evaluate()[source]#

Evaluate the fitness of all individuals in the population. :return:

_get_fitness()[source]#
_kill_off_worst()[source]#
_reproduce()[source]#
get_testing_data()[source]#
get_training_data()[source]#
simulate()[source]#

Simulate the population for the number of generations. Callable method. :return:
